Description: Wall fragment of an Attic red-figured pottery bell-krater. To left, part of a hunter holding two spears in his left hand; centre, ithyphallic herm facing left; to right, frontal figure, probably female, head turned right. Added white on woman's head-band and necklace.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College Dublin, Department of Classics, Classical Museum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Vickers erroneously cites G.138.24 as the original Ashmolean Museum registration number of this piece, but in fact the number is G.138.33.
Attributed by Vickers to the Pronomos Painter.
Bibliographic references: CVA UCD & UCC / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Ireland, Fascicule 1: University College Dublin, University College Cork (p. 41, no. 3, pl. 30, no. 3)
Vickers 1971 / Some Unpublished Sherds from Naukratis in Dublin (p. 118, no. 18, pl. 14.R)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1138)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: AN1896-1908-G.138.33 (Old Ashmolean Museum accession number)
